title: Programming Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Course Using Sub-Goal Labeling

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic programming syntax and simple coding experience
context.additional_context: In a BYOD environment, students learn individually via mobile devices with daily 20-minute microlearning sessions, while teachers provide real-time feedback and manage formative assessments

learning_goals: Students can decompose a given programming problem into at least three sub-goals and label them
Students achieve over 80% accuracy in solving new problems using labeled sub-goal examples
Learners can improve their labeling strategies through peer and self-assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
